artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Kiya Sōjirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: vertical ōban diptych; a (left): seated man wearing black robe with subtle brocade and yellow headdress with blue cord under chin; b (right): standing woman wearing kimono with many patterns and gold headdress with rooster and hanging strands of multicolored beads, holding a white fan with a large orange cord; cherry blossoms at top
dimension:
14 × 9 11/16 in. (35.56 × 24.61 cm) (image, sheet, a, vertical ōban)
14 × 9 3/4 in. (35.56 × 24.77 cm) (image, sheet, b, vertical ōban)
29 × 22 3/4 × 1 1/2 in. (73.66 × 57.79 × 3.81 cm) (outer frame)
medium: Woodblock prints (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
signed: in toshidama cartouche on each sheet: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: King and Queen of the Doll's Festival
